body: If you know me, I never get bothered by other peoples grammar, or bother to have good grammar myself, just enough so everyone understands what I'm writing. But it really bothers me when someone says "would of" instead of "would have". Anyone else have this problem?
body_tagged: If you know me, I never get bothered by other peoples grammar, or bother to have good grammar myself, just enough so everyone understands what I'm writing. But it really bothers me when someone says "would of" instead of "would have". Anyone else have this problem?
title: Bothering me

replies.body:
yeah.
I would of punched them had I not held in my anger
^^^^^^^
replies.body_tagged:
yeah.
I would of punched them had I not held in my anger
^^^^^^^

replies.body:
I always spend at least 5-6 minutes, focusing on those words. They confuse me....

Actually, I did some research on them; but there were no facts.... just opinions ;-;

replies.body: Actually, "would have" is grammatically correct. People write "would of" due to the similar pronunciation when someone says "would've"
replies.body_tagged: Actually, "would have" is grammatically correct. People write "would of" due to the similar pronunciation when someone says "would've"
